## Distinguishing Features

Often obscured below herbs, algae and other bryophytes, this rare seep hornwort has a scantly dissected, smooth dark-green thallus that can form extensive populations of overlapping dime-sized plants. The diagnostic feature is found on the underside, where round yellowish &quot;bulbils&quot; that function in asexual reproduction can be found in abundance. Horns, when present, are very short (~1cm tall).

## Similar species

No other hornwort (or thallose liverwort!) possesses bulbils on the underside of the thallus, making P. bulbiculosus unmistakeable even if hard to find.

## Habitat

Fine sediment seeps, rare in SW BC.
